ben.ladalja

Class QueryBuilderORM

  • java.lang.Object
    • ben.ladalja.QueryBuilder<QueryBuilderORM>
      • ben.ladalja.QueryBuilderORM

  • public class QueryBuilderORM
extends QueryBuilder<QueryBuilderORM>
    This class is just a custom QueryBuilder for model
    The main difference is that class return models instead of java.sql.ResultSet
    When you are using this class, don't use the inherited methods, use redefined instead otherwise UnsupportedOperationException will be throw for example instead of use get(), use get(Class) where Class is the model class you want to be returned
    Author:
    MEZATSONG TSAFACK Carrel, meztsacar@gmail.com
    See Also:
    QueryBuilder

        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from class: QueryBuilder
        The query builder may also be used to write join statements. To perform a basic "inner join", you may use the join method on a query builder instance. The first argument passed to the join method is the name of the table you need to join to, while the remaining arguments specify the column constraints for the join. Of course, you can join at most two tables in a single query
        Overrides:
